0.text:
Hey guys! Listen up! This is one of the most
important videos that’s ever been on my

4.text:
channel. Today, I’m talking about the brain
and why we should work to balance it—also

9.text:
giving you some techniques for balancing your
brain.

12.text:
Most people alive today are living with brain
imbalances. It doesn’t stop them being humans

19.text:
in the world, having families and having jobs;
but it does stop them from ever reaching holistic

26.text:
understanding. They do not themselves live
from any kind of holistic centre in their

34.text:
own lives. They’re either too much in their
emotions or too much in their logical side.

39.text:
And this is why we have issues in the world,
the greater world in general: because so many

45.text:
of us are living imbalanced. We’re too much
in one side, not enough in the other.

50.text:
So I believe that when we change ourselves
inside, and we move towards being balanced

55.text:
individuals, this is when we get the widest
possible understanding. And, for me also,

61.text:
this is what it means to grow as a person.
I believe that most or all of us start life

68.text:
with one kind of imbalance: we’re either
too much in the left side or too much in the

72.text:
right. But, if we decide to grow, and if we
choose to grow as adults, the path of that

79.text:
growth is developing ourselves so that we’re
balanced in the two sides. So if you think

84.text:
of the Yin-Yang symbol, we go from just being
all in one side and never in the other to

91.text:
being that fifty-fifty blend of the two sides,
and without excluding the other.

98.text:
So a person who is too much in their left
brain, with the left-brain imbalance, what

108.text:
it means is that the overall function of the
brain is stunted so that the oldest part of

114.text:
the brain, the reptile brain, takes over on
an instinctual level. And it means that emotions

124.text:
and compassion in a person that’s fully
in their left brain is squashed down and isn’t

131.text:
felt, isn’t experienced, and everything
in their mind is all to do with “It’s

137.text:
this, it’s that; it’s this, it’s that”—logic,
logic, logic...to the total exclusion of everything

143.text:
else. This kind of person is a dominator kind
of person who’s controlling and controls

150.text:
the lives of other people.
Someone with the right-brain imbalance, represented

157.text:
by the bunny rabbit, is someone who is ruled
by their emotions, and they’re like an empathy-compassion

167.text:
sponge. If they’ve got their heart on their
sleeve all the time, they’re completely

171.text:
ruled by their emotions. And they can’t
make a rational decision about anything, because

178.text:
they’re just always in their emotions and,
a lot of the time, experiencing fear and worry,

185.text:
like a little rabbit caught in the headlights.
And this kind of person is a... Whereas we’ve

193.text:
got the controller with the left-brain dominant,
the right-brain dominant person is the passive,

203.text:
slave mentality kind of person. Someone with
a right-brain imbalance is not someone that’s

209.text:
able to create a goal and work towards it.
They’ll always create reasons in their life

215.text:
why they can’t do this, why it wouldn’t
work; or they’ll do it later, but they never

219.text:
ever get round to it. They talk a lot sometimes
about the things they’re going to do, but

224.text:
it never ever happens. They hold themselves
back from a lot of things; they don’t believe

231.text:
in themselves: they’re unworthy... Oftentimes,
they have addictions as well.

237.text:
And these two go hand in hand. So usually,
in a relationship, there’ll be a person

245.text:
with the left-brain imbalance with the person
with the right-brain imbalance. So that’s

252.text:
why there is this power dynamic in most relationships
we see around us: because most people in the

262.text:
world have this brain imbalance.
So let’s talk about... I’ve got some ways

269.text:
for balancing the brain now. A good starting
point for anybody who decides, “I’ve had

277.text:
enough with my life and the dramas in my life,
and this not working for me,” or “I want

283.text:
to change,” a person who decides, wants
to change: a good starting point is always

288.text:
meditation. What I would recommend is that
you do ten minutes sitting meditation. Just

295.text:
sit down in your house, one time a day, every
day, and focus on the space in the middle

301.text:
of your head for ten minutes. And every time
you find your thoughts wandering away, come

307.text:
back and put them there. And you just do that
every time you notice. Don’t worry about

312.text:
doing it wrong or not being good at it. The
whole point is that you just return your thought

316.text:
there every single time.
Let’s start with left-brain imbalance, because

321.text:
most people in the world are operating from
left-brain imbalance. And this comes to us

330.text:
as a result of culture, I would say, because
the education system moulds children from

336.text:
a very early age to be all about repeating,
suppressing the creative force in people,

343.text:
forcing people into routines all day long.
It suppresses, and over time, stamps out and

350.text:
causes the right brain just to give up in
many people.

353.text:
You want to be doing things that are expressive.
If you see my kinds of drawings that I put

358.text:
on my channel: my drawings are from my imagination,
and they’re very quick lines; they’re

364.text:
expressive, they’re to show feelings. This
kind of art, in your own style—it doesn’t

369.text:
have to be like mine—is going to be a lot
more useful for you than doing something neat

375.text:
and tidy and following patterns.
The next thing: improvisation. Very, very

381.text:
few people in the world are good at improvisation.
I know this because I’ve trained people

388.text:
to do it before. And improvisation is all
to do with the right brain. So if you can’t

394.text:
improvise like I’m doing now speaking, it
doesn’t mean that you’ll never be able

398.text:
to do it. It’s just showing you that right
now, you’re very much brain-imbalanced in

404.text:
the left side, that you don’t know how to
improvise. You don’t know what to say: “Wuh,

408.text:
wuh, wuh..! How am I meant to talk?”
So, talking from myself, I’ve been doing

414.text:
it about four years now; it does get easier.
But it gets easier the more and more I just

419.text:
practise; the more I go into the spontaneous,
talking-in-the-moment part, the easier it

426.text:
gets. It takes time, but it does definitely
bring you over more into the other side.

434.text:
Another thing you can do: Dance without rules.
So find a dance class that’s more just about

439.text:
expression: “I can do whatever I want.”
Improvise... You know that improvising kind

443.text:
of dance that everybody laughs at: be a leaf
falling from a tree or something. That kind

449.text:
of dance (although probably your worst nightmare,
if you’re a left-brained imbalanced person)

455.text:
is going to be the kind of thing that really
stretches you in that way.

458.text:
An easier thing to try, but maybe the result
won’t be great, is cooking without recipes.

466.text:
See if you can do things without following
the step-by-step rules every time. Make it

471.text:
up as you go along, or try something new...is
a way of stretching your creative, improvisation

477.text:
side. Be spontaneous: try to do things without
plan; or at least try to do things without

483.text:
a plan one day a week. You can start small
and you can stretch your spontaneous nature.

492.text:
You can also do contemplation-meditation,
which means: you could go outside into a natural

501.text:
place and just sit there and do nothing. Just
look at the trees, look at the grass; think,

507.text:
muse on things; just be there without doing
anything.

511.text:
Also, a person who’s very much in their
left brain tends not... No, a person who’s

517.text:
very much in their left brain usually doesn’t
believe in anything to do with intuition or

524.text:
psychic stuff, says it’s not true, says,”
Astrology is all garbage, it’s not true,

530.text:
I don’t believe in any of it.” When you’re
very much in your left brain, you don’t

534.text:
have any evidence of that stuff going on in
your life, so it doesn’t seem true to you.

540.text:
And the reason you don’t have any evidence
of that stuff going on in your life is because

544.text:
your right side of the brain is so deadened,
or inactive, that it...in your experience,

550.text:
it seems like it’s all made up and it’s
nonsense.

553.text:
So, another way that you can stretch into
the right side of the brain is to choose some

561.text:
form of intuitive mode or kind of studies,
so that you start to learn about those kinds

570.text:
of things. For example, you could learn a
system like...you could learn something about

575.text:
astrology; you could learn something about
numerology. And then, with that knowledge,

580.text:
start applying your intuition to things you
don’t know. Try and...before you go...before

587.text:
you meet someone, try to imagine, if you’ve
never met them before, imagine what they look

592.text:
like. Try to imagine details about them before
you go. And in these kind of ways, you start

601.text:
to stretch—even though it seems like you’re
just making it up at the beginning—it’s

605.text:
an exercise to stretch that intuitive power
that we are all capable of having, but many

612.text:
of us don’t ever experience, because we’re
always too much in the left brain.

617.text:
If you have a right-brained imbalance—so,
remember: if you’re the “rabbit” kind

622.text:
of person, who is on the passive side, not
good at working towards their goals, and is

631.text:
always in their emotions—for you, a lot
comes down to learning to ground yourself

642.text:
in the physical world. So, for example, don’t
be floating around in the stars or blah, blah,

648.text:
blah. Ground yourself in the physical world.
But also study things that are to do with

655.text:
logic and rationality. So don’t think it’s
not important or it’s not worth knowing.

664.text:
Choose these things to study, because it gives
you a really good grounding. So, for example,

670.text:
some things that I’m learning lately: I’ve
been learning something about genes or neuroscience,

676.text:
because it’s interesting to me. It’s also
very, very scientific; and there are other

683.text:
ways that I like to look at things, too. But
I find it...for me, it’s a good balance

688.text:
to get some of the science in there, rather
than just be in alternative knowledge. Getting

696.text:
the science in is really what it means to
think holistically. Rather than just believing

702.text:
in everything because it’s alternative,
or believing in everything because it’s

707.text:
science and a science...a scientist said it,
we need to come to some kind of balance.

713.text:
For right-brain dominant people, number puzzles
like Sudoku are good; doing crosswords; doing

723.text:
art—but a different kind of art. You want
to do something that’s very detail-orientated

727.text:
or art that’s to do with patterns, art that’s
realism. So copying a picture, for example,

737.text:
and making that picture look the same, is
another good technique.

741.text:
If you have a religion, actually study your
religion and be able to look at the good bits

748.text:
as well as the bad bits. Because, if you believe
in something, I think it’s really important

753.text:
that you’re fully knowledgeable about it,
and you can answer questions that people have

757.text:
about your religion. So there’s a difference
between just blindly believing something because

762.text:
you were told to do it and being informed
about all the reasons that you decide to believe

767.text:
that.
Also, plan and carry out a project. A lot

772.text:
of people with the right-brain imbalance have
trouble just getting stuff done or even starting.

778.text:
So start small: create a small project for
yourself and make sure that happens.

786.text:
Another thing I would say here is: a lot of
people with right-brain imbalance, they get

794.text:
lost in addictions and things like that. And
they have not very good willpower to pull

801.text:
themselves out of it. But if, for example,
you’re a smoker or you drink lots of coffee,

806.text:
you could try to cut one of those things out
and dedicate yourself to cutting that out.

814.text:
And that gives you a kind of...that gives
you a kind of inner strength by building...building

819.text:
the power of your will.
So, I also want to mention here that some

826.text:
people have imbalance...a little bit imbalanced
on the left side and a little imbalance on

832.text:
the right side. So, if that applies to you,
if you can see yourself in the two sides,

837.text:
then you want to be trying some things that
are good for balancing the left brain and

843.text:
some things that are good for balancing the
right brain.

846.text:
It’s not a...the things that I’m telling
you about today, it’s not like a quick fix

851.text:
that you just do it for one week and suddenly
you won’t have brain imbalance anymore.

856.text:
This is more a...a mode of living for life.
For example, me doing the speech improvisation,

866.text:
which is all the videos on my channel. I’ve
learnt how to do this now, so I could stop,

871.text:
couldn’t I? Could stop. But I don’t stop,
because there’s always deeper to go into

878.text:
it, and there’s always...you can always
improve and get better.

883.text:
This path of pushing yourself in...developing
your weaker side is another way of saying

890.text:
it...is, over time...is going to bring very
positive changes to anybody’s life, like

896.text:
it has to mine. I was doing this stuff without
knowing what I was doing, but I can see that

903.text:
it’s taken my life in a good direction.
So I would like that to happen for other people,

907.text:
and I would also like the positive changes
to happen in the world by having more balanced

912.text:
people out there, rather than all the controlling
types, or all the emotional, reactive, “can’t

919.text:
do anything” types.
So, thank you for watching, and join me again
